data.message: I used to be able to view Friends Lists posts (Close Friends, Family, Acquaintances, etc) by clicking on the bottom right corner of my home page and then clicking on the list I wanted to view. It is now gone and there is no way for me to view the posts of my friends in these lists. Please help or, if it has been removed as an option, bring it back!  This was how I was able to see the posts of important groups of people in my life since Facebook is controlling my newsfeed.

replies.message: Hey, Jan. Thanks for bringing this to our attention. This sounds like a feature issue. Please help us track these issues and submit the problem to support through our Help Center: http://bit.ly/2dhNZlo. -Rhea

Facebook A guy I type with (not a FB friend now) was asked to approve a request to chat with me.  Prior to that, we had chatted normally as if friends.  The thing is, I didn't send him any request.  It says he accepted my request but it's a non-existent one.  How did that happen?  Thx in advance for any suggested answer.
I am super frustrated by this too. It used to be so easy to see your specific feeds. But now it's buried in the menu.

Has FB recently changed the news feed? I only see about 3 of my friends and absolutely no groups or pages! It's useless...I hope this change is not permanent. Why won't FB allow the users to choose how they want their feed??
